How to Install googler on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • googler

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install googler on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing googler on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall googler in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install googler, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install googler Using apt

To install googler in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install googler using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install googler

The installation of googler might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install googler Using apt-get

To install googler using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install googler.

sudo apt-get -y install googler

Install googler Using Synaptic

To install googler using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install googler on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for googler. This will display the googler package in the package window, now to install googler, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the googler package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of googler.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install googler Using aptitude

To install googler on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of googler.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install googler using the command aptitude install googler.

sudo aptitude -y install googler

How to Upgrade googler on debian

If you want to upgrade the googler package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade googler using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade googler to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade googler.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade googler sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade googler

Upgrade googler using Aptitude

To upgrade googler using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade googler.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade googler

Upgrade googler using Synaptic

To upgrade googler using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for googler, now right-click googler, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade googler just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall googler on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall googler from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just googler, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove googler

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of googler

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of googler you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge googler

Remove googler using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall googler using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for googler, right-click the googler package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall googler click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install googler on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade googler using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of googler then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
